str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.
Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
With difficulty, hardly. Adverb from duskolos; impracticably.
Rich, abounding in, wealthy; subst: a rich man. From ploutos; wealthy; figuratively, abounding with.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.
